applicationProfileDefinition.en: More readable representation with only the basic data of the address, intended for the use of an address as an attribute of another object.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The complete address in one string, formatted or not.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Avoids errors due to splitting the address into its parts. Displays the prescribed order of the different parts.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: State in which an object is located.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Valid for a certain period of time. Refers to a Material Thing, e.g. a Man-made Object or Feature.

Quantifiable property of an Entity.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: The property is measurable with a certain precision and can be represented by a value, i.e. a point or area in a mathematical or conceptual space, such as a natural or real number, an RGB value, etc.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Description of the Dimension.
The unit in which the value is expressed.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: To be used if no standard unit is known.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The standardized unit in which the value is expressed.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Number by which the quantity of the attribute can be expressed.
Information used to uniquely identify an object.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: The starting point here is that this string is assigned by an organization and that this is done according to a well-defined system.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Name of the agent who assigned the identifier.
Time when the identifier was issued.
Link to the agent that issued the identifier.
String used to uniquely identify the object.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Type of string refers to the identification system (including its version), the string itself to the actual identifier.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A location can be an identifiable geographic location (ISO 19112), but this location can also be a non-geographic location, such as a directory, row, or column. As such, there are numerous ways in which location can be expressed, such as the

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Indication of a geographical position, by means of coordinates, a toponym, an address label, a reference to a city/region or reference to an address.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Indication of a quantity.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: In practice the primitive data types with which a quantity can be indicated, see xsd data types float, double, decimal, integer etc.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: More or less defined duration.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: NOTE

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Information such as email, telephone, address that allows you to contact someone or something.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. a person or organization or service... Possible forms of contact: calling, emailing, etc.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Technique or method used in the Activity.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. embroidery, painting, carbon dating etc.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Material used in the Modification.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Note: this Material can, but does not have to, become part of the Material Thing (e.g. steel in the repair of a ship vs distilled water in the restoration of a painting).

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Tangible or intangible Thing used and essential to the performance or result of the Activity.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. tools, instruments, raw materials, loose objects without which the Activity could not take place. E.g. if the Activity is to write a text, then a computer and software are required.

Entity Identifier.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: When implemented in RDF, the Entity URI is the identifier. Primarily intended for commonly used identifiers, does not necessarily have to be a technical identifier but can also be a name, for example.
